title: Fundamental Illustrations in Adobe Illustrator
headline: This free online course teaches you how to manipulate basic geometric shapes to create art using Adobe Illustrator.
description: Do you want to learn how to use Adobe Illustrator? This beginner’s course teaches you the fundamental principles needed to create vector arts. We will introduce you to Adobe Illustrator's basic tools that allow you to manipulate simple geometric shapes, such as rectangles, circles, and stars. This knowledge will help create stunning but straightforward illustrations. If you are passionate about creating digital arts, you'll enjoy this course!

courseDescription:
Are you interested in vector arts but don’t know where to start? Illustrators are in high demand in a large variety of fields. The options are endless, from graphic designers and animators to production designers in film, book illustrators, and creative ad designers. But, perhaps, you simply love art and would love to know how to create pieces using Adobe Illustrator. Just like painters who use oil paints to draw beautiful canvases, there are artists out there who create stunning works of art and then sell their work online. If this intrigues you, enrol now for free. This course is designed to introduce you to Adobe Illustrator and teach you how to use its primary tools to create your own vector arts. Learn the foundational principles that will help you create stunning artwork using simple geometric shapes.

This course demonstrates how you can download Adobe Illustrator on your computer and then teaches you how to use its menu, save files, and create digital canvases or artboards, where you will be developing your art. You will then learn to create and manipulate primary shapes, such as circles, squares, rectangles, and triangles. Once you know how to work with these, you will start creating easy works of art, such as a bell, a trophy, a skate shoe, and other everyday items. This foundation helps you become familiar with Illustrator’s basic tools. For example, learn how to use the Pathfinder tool to intersect different shapes, add or extract areas, and even combine different shape patterns. Another important tool you will learn to use is the Shape Builder tool that allows you to intuitively merge, edit, and fill shapes on your artboard.

As you study all of the course’s tutorial videos, you will learn how to access different tools by using shortcuts on your keyboard. The illustrations in these tutorials will also become more and more complex as you get further into the material. You will create images of animals, superheroes and even emojis. Combine colours and learn how to add shadows to give your illustrations depth, making them ‘pop’. This course is easy to follow, and no experience is required. All you need is a willingness to learn and a love for art. You already have the most crucial tool: a creative mind. Now, learn how to use the tools provided by Adobe Illustrator and let your imagination do the rest. This course is entirely free, so you have nothing to lose and everything to gain, including an optional certificate.

Start Course Now

Your Alison certificate is:

  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

  • Lesson Summary

  • Useful tips while working with Adobe Illustrator: 
    • The smart guide helps you align, edit, and transform objects or artboards relative to other objects, artboards, or both by snap-aligning and displaying X, Y locations. You can enable the smart guide by going to View>Smart Guide. 
    • Use the Shift key to constrain the ellipse and create a perfect circle. 
    • Use the Strokes panel to specify whether a line is solid or dashed, the width, and the styles of a line.
    • Use the Pathfinder panel (Window > Pathfinder) to combine objects into new shapes. 
    • Bring an object to the front of another object with the pop-up menu using the following path: right-click>arrange>bring to front.
    • The Expand function in Illustrator transforms strokes into vector shapes with editable outlines and anchor points.  

  • Module Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Indicate how to use the Shape Builder tool.
    • List various keyboard shortcuts to quickly access different tools quickly. 
    • State how to create stickers and emojis.
    • Describe how to create superheroes using Adobe Illustrator.

  • Lesson Summary

  • To add colour to the background of your artboard, use the Rectangle Tool (M), draw a rectangle inside your artboard and fit it to all four edges of your artboard. Then follow these steps: 
    1. Using the Fill option (X) from the left-hand Tool Bar, change the colour of your new rectangle to your desired colour.
    2. Open the Layers panel (Window > Layers), move the new layer (your new rectangle) to the very bottom of the panel, and toggle on the Lock icon (next to the Eye icon). 
    3. Congratulations! You now have a locked colour layer as the base layer of your project!
  • Pathfinder tool important options: 
  • Add To Shape Area: Adds the area of the component to the underlying geometry.
  • Subtract from Shape Area: Cuts out the area of the component from the underlying geometry.
  • Intersect Shape Areas: Uses the area of the component to clip the underlying geometry as a mask would.
  • Exclude Overlapping Shape Areas: Uses the area of the component to invert the underlying geometry, turning filled regions into holes and vice versa.
